page.title: 11EDUCATION IN ELMBRIDGE
page.content: Adults outnumber children by four to one. This could be because most of this property is to expensive for the average young family. Sixteen children are at Independent Schools, and only eleven in the state system. Most of the over fives being privately educated are at boarding school. Part or full time further education is well supported. This ranges from day release through universities and polytechnics to local authority recreational and vocational classes. Thirteen people are at college, polytechnic or university, and ten at recreational or vocational classes. The area includes one full time teacher who also teaches at evening classes and another who teaches vocational subjects. Education appears important to this community, who spend both time and money on many aspects.
